rt2_assignment_sphinx documentation!

This is the sphinx documentation of rt2_assignment1!

GoToPoint Module

Publishes to:

/cmd_vel(geometry_msgs.msg.Twist) /destination(std_msgs.msg.Float32)

Subscribes to:

/sub_odom(nav_msgs.msg.Odometry) /sub_vel(geometry_msgs.msg.Twist)

ServiceServer:

none

ActionServer:

/go_to_point (rt2_assignment1.action.Moving)

Description:

The node controls the behavior of the non-holonomic according to the go_to_point behavior via an action server. A FSM is used to model the behavior every time a new goal pose is received: firstly the robot alight its position with the goal’s one, then it goes straight to the goal position, it aligns with the goal orientation and then the goal pose is reached.

The linear and angular velocities are set by the node /user_interface and they are received on the topic /vel. Both the velocities are set to zero in case the goal is cancelled by the client.

scripts.go_to_point.change_state(state)[source]

This function has the scope to update the current global state

Parameters

state (int) – new updated state

Returns

None

scripts.go_to_point.clbk_odom(msg)[source]

This function is the Odometry callback It retrieves (x,y,theta) from the Odom message.

Parameters

msg (Odometry) – odometry message.

Returns

None

scripts.go_to_point.done()[source]

This funciton has the aim of stopping the robot. It sets the linear and the angular velocity to zero.

Parameters

None –

Returns

None

scripts.go_to_point.fix_final_yaw(des_yaw)[source]

This function orients the robot in the desidered orientation, based the error between the current orientation and the desired one. It sets the angular velocity to obtain the desidered orientation. It also updates the state to done, once the orientation is set.

Parameters

des_yaw (float) – desidered (theta) position

Returns

None

scripts.go_to_point.fix_yaw(des_pos)[source]

This function orients the robot in the desidered way. The function is used in two situations:

  1. When the robot has to be oriented toward the goal (x,y) position.

  2. When the robot has already reached the goal (x,y) position and it has to achieve the goal orientation.

It sets the angular velocity to reach the goal position. It also updates the state to the behavior go_straight, based on the orientation error.

Parameters

des_pos (Point) – desidered (x,y) position

Returns

None

scripts.go_to_point.go_straight_ahead(des_pos)[source]

This function implements the behavior that allows the robot to reach the goal. It sets the linear and angular velocities depending on the distance to the goal pose.

Parameters

des_pos (Point) – desidered (x,y) position

Returns

None

scripts.go_to_point.go_to_point(req)[source]

This function implements the state machine. It sets the correct behavior that the robot will follow, based on the current robot state. The FMS continues until the goal is reached or the goal is cancelled

Parameters

req (MovingActionGoal) – (x,y,theta) goal pose)

Returns

None

scripts.go_to_point.normalize_angle(angle)[source]

This function normalizes the angle between [-pi,pi].

Parameters

angle (float) – input angle

Returns

normalized angle

Return type

angle (float)

scripts.go_to_point.velocity_clbk(velocity)[source]

The data received on the topic /vel are saved in vel, a global variable of type Twist.

Parameters
